pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw:
I think adding this public member variable breaks ABI. Our ABI checker flagged it, though it has lots of false positives and is tricky to interpret:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/420/API_ABI_report

~~This can be retargeted to default if the variable is essential~~
content.html:
I think adding this public member variable breaks ABI. Our ABI checker flagged it, though it has lots of false positives and is tricky to interpret:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/420/API_ABI_report

This can be retargeted to default if the variable is essential

content.raw:
maybe we could add a default parameter to the Start function:

~~~
bool Start(const LogRecordParams &_params, const bool _recordWithModel=false)
~~~

we could merge that forward to default, then deprecate it in favor of the original version that just takes a single `LogRecodParams` reference?
content.html:
maybe we could add a default parameter to the Start function:

bool Start(const LogRecordParams &_params, const bool _recordWithModel=false)

we could merge that forward to default, then deprecate it in favor of the original version that just takes a single LogRecodParams reference?

content.html:
Will recordWithModel inside LogRecordPrivate.hh break ABI as well?
~If not, then we can probably remove this one here, though I am not 100% sure yet, there might be a way to always access this->dataPtr to get the value~

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw:
We have to find a way to passing in the `recordWithModel` variables from `Server.cc`. Therefore, I cannot just drop it from the `LogRecordParams` definition.  
I followed your suggestion by adding another `Start` function which takes a default value of `recordWithModel` as `false`    
Commit [d7ad6ff](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/d7ad6ff2ced2aa59c2ea5663e4b993de35e1169c?at=gazebo7) reflects these changes
content.html:
We have to find a way to passing in the recordWithModel variables from Server.cc. Therefore, I cannot just drop it from the LogRecordParams definition.
I followed your suggestion by adding another Start function which takes a default value of recordWithModel as false
Commit d7ad6ff reflects these changes

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw: I think we'll need to be careful about adding a new overload function. According to [this page](https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C%2B%2B), it's binary compatible but not source compatible.
content.html: I think we'll need to be careful about adding a new overload function. According to this page, it's binary compatible but not source compatible.

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw: Just a slight comment on semantics. Throughout this pull request the term "record models" is being used but technically, _models_ are already recorded without the pull request. What is missing is other resources, like meshes and textures. So I'd propose changing the API and options to say "record with resources" instead.
content.html: Just a slight comment on semantics. Throughout this pull request the term "record models" is being used but technically, models are already recorded without the pull request. What is missing is other resources, like meshes and textures. So I'd propose changing the API and options to say "record with resources" instead.

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw:
a few issues to resolve:

* saving meshes and materials that use absolute URI paths

* saving models inserted after launching the world

* saving gazebo media resources (e.g. a few models references: `file://media/materials/scripts/gazebo.material`)
content.html:
a few issues to resolve:

  • saving meshes and materials that use absolute URI paths

  • saving models inserted after launching the world

  • saving gazebo media resources (e.g. a few models references: file://media/materials/scripts/gazebo.material)

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw:
Fixed the 3 issues above in d91b5fc and added test in `gz_log.cc` that captures all 3 scenarios
 
Updated approach:

* uri's starting with `model://` - entire model directory is saved

* uri's starting with `file://` or `/`:  - only the file is saved\*

*there is a hacky workaround for saving `file://` mesh files that contain path to textures, e.g. dae may reference `../materials/textures/abc.png`, same for obj's mtl files. The workaround is to copy the entire model directory that contains the mesh file.
content.html:
Fixed the 3 issues above in d91b5fc and added test in gz_log.cc that captures all 3 scenarios

Updated approach:

  • uri's starting with model:// - entire model directory is saved

  • uri's starting with file:// or /: - only the file is saved*

*there is a hacky workaround for saving file:// mesh files that contain path to textures, e.g. dae may reference ../materials/textures/abc.png, same for obj's mtl files. The workaround is to copy the entire model directory that contains the mesh file.

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw:
for testing, launch gazebo with the following arguments:

~~~
gazebo --verbose -r --record_resources`
~~~

insert models, move them around, etc, then close gazebo

The state.log file, models, and other resources should be stored in `~/.gazebo/log/<timestamped_dir>/gzserver/`
content.html:
for testing, launch gazebo with the following arguments:

gazebo --verbose -r --record_resources`

insert models, move them around, etc, then close gazebo

The state.log file, models, and other resources should be stored in ~/.gazebo/log/<timestamped_dir>/gzserver/

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw: Actually the path changes each time the test is run, so we need to clear it in the end, and this is especially important not to clutter people's computers
content.html: Actually the path changes each time the test is run, so we need to clear it in the end, and this is especially important not to clutter people's computers

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw: The paths are in the local build folder. We could leave the paths alone, to support debugging. The assumption is that the build folder is meant to be cleared by the user.
content.html: The paths are in the local build folder. We could leave the paths alone, to support debugging. The assumption is that the build folder is meant to be cleared by the user.

pullrequest.title: Save models' material and meshes when logging targeting gazebo7

content.raw: Ok, fair enough. Must keep in mind that this may be taking a lot of space in your computer while testing, I'm not sure if Jenkins completely clears the build folder in-between runs.
content.html: Ok, fair enough. Must keep in mind that this may be taking a lot of space in your computer while testing, I'm not sure if Jenkins completely clears the build folder in-between runs.

content.html:
@scpeters pointed out that this PR broke the homebrew build:

/Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/gazebo/gazebo/util/LogRecord.cc:679:23: error: invalid operands to binary expression ('boost::system::error_code' and 'int')
        if (errorCode != 0 || !gazebo::common::copyDir(srcPath, destPath))
            ~~~~~~~~~ ^  ~
/Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/gazebo/gazebo/util/LogRecord.cc:695:23: error: invalid operands to binary expression ('boost::system::error_code' and 'int')
        if (errorCode == 0)
            ~~~~~~~~~ ^  ~
